sec.div: 3.1. Extraction and Chemical Composition of the Essential Oils
sec.p: Distilled essential oil of A. citriodora features: appearance (mobile liquid, clear), color (yellow, more or less dark), characteristic odor (lemony, fresh), and density at 20Â°C (0.879).

Among 72 peaks revealed by chromatography ( Figure 1), 64 peaks (96%) were identified (according to National Institute of Standards and Technology database). Twenty-four among 64 peaks represent 80% of the essential oil compounds ( Table 1). Eight peaks were for unknown compounds and probably represent 4% of the essential oils.

Molecules belonging to five biochemical families, namely, sesquiterpenes (Ar-curcumene 12.32%), terpene oxides (caryophyllene oxide 13.68%), sesquiterpenols (spathulenol 12.38%), monoterpene aldehydes (neral 8.07%), and monoterpenols (cis-verbenol 6.28%), constitute 53% of the essential oil's major compounds ( Table 2).
